actions.text: Referred jointly to the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
For Previous Action See H.R.512.
Ordered to be Reported.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.subcommittee: Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources.
Mr. Kostmayer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Burdick without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 851.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-438.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources

official_title: To provide for the construction, operation, and maintenance of an extension of the American Canal at El Paso, Texas.
short_title: Rio Grande American Canal Extension Act of 1990

summary.text: Rio Grande American Canal Extension Act of 1990 - Directs the Secretary of State to construct an extension of the Rio Grande American Canal to lie wholly within the United States, beginning at the downstream end of the current American Canal in El Paso, Texas, and extending to Riverside Heading, Texas. Outlines provisions concerning the operation, maintenance, use, and the El Paso County Water Improvement District's share of the costs of the canal extension. Repeals a previous construction authorization. Requires the Secretary to report to the Congress on findings from a study to determine the likelihood and extent of any damage to property adjacent to the American Canal which would be caused by subsidence related to the Canal extension. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: Rio Grande American Canal Extension Act of 1990
Rio Grande American Canal Extension Act of 1990
To provide for the construction, operation, and maintenance of an extension of the American Canal at El Paso, Texas.
